info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 6 at 9:00AM CDT until June 10 at 7:21AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Salt Fork Arkansas River at Tonkawa affecting Kay, Noble and Grant Counties.
Cimarron River near Waynoka affecting Woodward, Major and Woods Counties.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Salt Fork Arkansas River at Tonkawa.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Flood depths ranging up to about 8 feet move from eastern Grant County... across Kay County... to the confluence with the Arkansas River below Ponca City. Private levees may be overtopped... and farmland and oilfields are flooded hours before the crest. The southbound lanes of Interstate Highway I-35 may be threatened by floodwaters. Road closures include... Fountain Road at U.S. Highway 77 south of Tonkawa... and State Highway 156 between Marland and Ponca City.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The Salt Fork Arkansas River is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 24.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Grant, OK; Kay, OK; Noble, OK
